intro: Goniophlebium plectolepis, commonly known as the zigzag fern, is a member of the Huperziaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging fronds. It is a vascular plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The plant has a simple, unbranched rhizome with small, scale-like leaves arranged in a spiral pattern. Its reproductive structures include sporangia that produce spores for propagation. The botanical features of Goniophlebium plectolepis make it an interesting subject for studies on fern morphology and ecological adaptation.
